arch:property.oc:show_val: Before the removal of the Blockage Wall Locus 16, there were three extant ashlars visible in this doorjamb, whereas after the removal of the wall there were six ashlars, one set above the other in a regularized programmed pattern of Nabataean architecture. The upper extant ashlar was set as a header 0.50 m-by-58; the second was a stretcher 0.75 m-by-0.38 m in height; and the third is a header 0.59 m in length-by-0.45 m in height. What was of interest in Locus 11 was the fact that there were large dowel holes in the doorjamb that provided the locking mechanism for (?) wooden doors that must have been used here in antiquity. In order to block access, the Byzantines had to resort to the building of walls to curtail traffic through Doorways #3 and #4.

Part I) Construction of the West Corridor Wall Locus 2 and Doorway 3 Doorjambs, Loci 4, 5 and Threshold Locus 14; Part II) Construction of the West Corridor Wall Locus 8; Part III) Construction of the West Corridor Wall Locus 13 and Doorway 4, and Doorjamb Locus 12. Locus 14  Threshold Block between Doorjambs Loci 4 and 5 of Doorway 3, Part II. Locus 17  Threshold Block between Locus 11 south Doorjamb and Locus 12 north Doorjamb.
Bottom elevation: 3.65 m below Point E or 885.96 m.

Phase IV: Nabataean Grand Design: 1st c. BCE to CE 1st c. The tetrastyle in antis temple is built, including the Porch extension, stylobate, Porch columns, East, West and South Corridor walls, East and West Walkway Walls and the East and West Porch Antae. Additionally, the limestone flooring from Phase II is extended at this time to cover the surfaces of the new corridors and walkways.

2.77 m height = extant limestone ashlars set as headers and stretchers with mortar. The average size of each ashlar is 0.59 m in length-by-0.45 m in height; the average width of each ashlar is 0.31 m.
Top elevation: 0.83 m below Point E or 888.78 m.
Construction of the West Corridor Wall.
Part of Doorway 3 in the West Corridor Wall, Locus 8, Part II
Locus 9 Pavement (Parts I-III); Locus 17, Threshold and Locus 13 West Corridor Wall, (both belong to Part III).
